avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted in thaw since Saturday. The snowpack is expected to be isothermal and rather homogeneous most places. A little new snow expected on top the next few days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.

weatherForecast.highlights: Smá snjókoma aðfaranótt miðvikudags í NA átt og síðan lítilsháttar éljagangur til fjalla í breytilegum áttum. Hiti í kringum frostmark.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many small avalanches released in Kirkjubólshlíð, probably in the rain the night before Wednesday 20.2. The largest avalanche stopped 50 m above the road. Small sluffs released in the area in warm weather and sunshine last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. New moist snow that is forecasted should generally bond well with existing snow. On Thursday however, snowfall and snowdrift in NE winds might form new unstable wind slabs.

snowpackStructure.highlights: In warm weather since Saturday, snow has subsided and partly melted. Weak layers in the snowpack seem to have gained strength. In stability tests 18.2., the weak layer broke at a higher additional load than a week earlier. Crystals had also rounded. New moist snow should generally bond well with existing snow. If the snowfall on Thusday is cold and dry, new unstable wind slabs might however form in S-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.

weatherForecast.highlights: Smá snjókoma eða slydda í NA-átt á miðvikudag. Samfelldari snjókoma og hvassari NA-átt seinnipart fimmtudags. Dregur smám saman úr á föstudag og kólnar.

avalancheActivity.comment: 300 m wide slab in Brimnesdalur was spotted 19.2. which has likely been triggered by the warming on 18.2. A snowmobile triggered another slab in Upsadalur above Dalvík 10.2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has settled in the warming during the weekend but still a weak layer is persistent that shows quite easy propagation as the 300 m wide slab in Brimnesdalur confirms. Some snow expected in a quick E-wind period on Wednesday and more snow in northerly winds on Thursday-Friday

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has settled in the warming during the weekend but still a weak layer is persistent. Stability tests in Skarðsdalur 17.2. showed quite easy propagation on the interface to the uppermost ice layer in the snowpack

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snörp A-átt um tíma á mið. með snjókomu til fjalla en lengra áhlaup á fim-fös. með stífri N-lægri átt og snjókomu

avalancheActivity.comment: A slab avalanche released in Skagafell in Fagridalur 18/2 and wet loose avalanches released in Norðfjörður. Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður 14/2. Avalanches in N-aspect in Seyðisfjörður and S-aspect in Eskifjörður and Norðfjörður 12/2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Snowfall in variable wind is expected in mountains the next few days. New unstable wind slabs may form in most aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: In warm weather since Saturday, snow has subsided and partly melted. Snow widely became isothermal deep into the snowpack. Weak layers seem to have gained strength but avalanches on them are still possible in very steep terrain and gullies. Snowfall and snowdrift in variable wind is expected in mountains the next few days, most snowdrift should be from NE-SE winds. New unstable wind slabs may form in various aspects, especially westerly.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided in warm weather since Saturday and weak layers have gained strength. Where new dry snow adds on top and drifts, unstable wind slabs may form.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma með köflum til fjalla í breytilegum vindáttum fram að helgi, hvassast þegar vindur er austanstæður. Hiti í kringum frostmark á láglendi, vægt frost til fjalla. Styttir upp um helgina og kólnar.
